warning_signs: Swelling, shortness of breath, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure daily

primary_diagnosis: Congestive Heart Failure (CHF), NYHA Class II
warning_signs: Rapid weight gain, worsening shortness of breath, chest pain
discharge_instructions: Daily weight monitoring and record

warning_signs: High fever, worsening cough, difficulty breathing
discharge_instructions: Complete full course of antibiotics

warning_signs: Symptoms of hypoglycemia, persistent hyperglycemia, polyuria
discharge_instructions: Check blood sugars before meals and at bedtime

warning_signs: Increased breathlessness, blue lips, confusion
discharge_instructions: Use inhalers as demonstrated and carry rescue inhaler

dietary_restrictions: Low potassium, low sodium, fluid restriction 1.2L/day
warning_signs: Reduced urine output, swelling, nausea/vomiting
discharge_instructions: Weigh daily and report >2kg gain in 48 hours

warning_signs: New weakness, severe headache, slurred speech
discharge_instructions: Begin prescribed physiotherapy program and speech exercises

warning_signs: Increased wound drainage, fever, calf swelling
discharge_instructions: Keep wound clean and dry; gradual weight-bearing as instructed

warning_signs: Chest pain, fainting, new shortness of breath
discharge_instructions: Cardiac rehab referral and activity guidelines provided

warning_signs: Fever, flank pain, persistent vomiting
discharge_instructions: Complete antibiotic course and obtain urine culture if symptoms persist

warning_signs: Increased leg swelling, sudden shortness of breath (PE signs)
discharge_instructions: Keep leg elevated and avoid long immobilization

dietary_restrictions: No alcohol while on methotrexate; maintain folate intake
warning_signs: New infections, persistent fever, unusual bleeding
discharge_instructions: Monitor for side effects of medications and have labs in 1 week

warning_signs: Persistent abdominal pain, fever, jaundice
discharge_instructions: Return to ER for severe abdominal pain or vomiting

primary_diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder - stabilized on medication
warning_signs: Suicidal thoughts, worsening depression, severe anxiety
discharge_instructions: Maintain follow-up and continue therapy; seek crisis help if needed

warning_signs: Severe headache, vision changes, chest pain
discharge_instructions: Home BP log twice daily and bring to appointment

dietary_restrictions: BRAT diet initially; avoid dairy until recovery
follow_up: Primary care in 1 week if not improved
warning_signs: Inability to tolerate fluids, high fever, bloody stools
discharge_instructions: Maintain adequate oral fluids and electrolytes

dietary_restrictions: Consistent carbohydrate intake; avoid missed meals
follow_up: Diabetes educator and endocrinology in 3 days
warning_signs: Ketones in urine, nausea/vomiting, high blood sugar despite insulin
discharge_instructions: Carry glucometer and ketone strips; sick-day action plan provided

medications: Vitamin C 500mg daily to aid absorption
dietary_restrictions: Increase dietary iron (lean meats, legumes); avoid tea/coffee with meals
warning_signs: Persistent fatigue, palpitations, shortness of breath
discharge_instructions: Take iron on empty stomach if tolerated; expect several weeks to improvement

warning_signs: Severe abdominal pain, fever, persistent vomiting
discharge_instructions: Gradual return to oral intake as tolerated

warning_signs: Recurrent weakness, speech difficulty, loss of vision
discharge_instructions: Avoid driving until cleared by neurology

medications: Cephalexin 500mg four times daily x10 days
follow_up: Wound clinic / Primary care in 3 days
warning_signs: Spreading redness, fever, increasing pain
discharge_instructions: Keep area elevated and clean; complete antibiotics

dietary_restrictions: Light diet initially; advance as tolerated
warning_signs: Fever, increasing abdominal pain, wound redness/drainage
discharge_instructions: Avoid heavy lifting for 2 weeks; wound care instructions given

warning_signs: Jaundice, abdominal swelling, confusion (encephalopathy)
discharge_instructions: Daily weights and monitor for swelling; vaccines reviewed

dietary_restrictions: Avoid known dietary triggers (aged cheese, red wine)
warning_signs: Increased frequency or severity of headaches, visual changes
discharge_instructions: Maintain headache diary; avoid overuse of acute medications

warning_signs: Increased breathlessness, blue lips, fever
discharge_instructions: Use inhalers as instructed; seek urgent care for worsening symptoms

warning_signs: Spreading redness, fever, increasing pain
discharge_instructions: Keep area elevated, complete antibiotic course

dietary_restrictions: Avoid NSAIDs and alcohol; small frequent meals
warning_signs: Black stools, severe abdominal pain, vomiting blood
discharge_instructions: Take acid suppression as prescribed and avoid irritants

medications: Amoxicillin 500mg three times daily x7 days
follow_up: Primary care in 1 week if persistent symptoms
warning_signs: High fever, severe ear pain, discharge from ear
discharge_instructions: Complete antibiotics and return if symptoms worsen

warning_signs: New weakness, slurred speech, vision changes
discharge_instructions: Avoid driving until cleared; attend stroke clinic
